column2: Project Role : Workplace Mgmt & Solutions Practitioner Project Role Description : Provide expertise and/or general administrative space and service support for Accenture people and businesses globally.  Must have skills : Property Management Systems (PMS) Good to have skills : NA Minimum  12  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Role for Property Management System Summary :As a Workplace Management & Solutions Practitioner, you will be responsible for providing expertise and general administrative space and service support for Accenture people and businesses globally. Your typical day will involve utilizing your skills in Property Management Systems (PMS) to ensure efficient and effective management of workplace spaces.  Roles & Responsibilities: Lead the implementation and management of Property Management Systems (PMS) to ensure efficient and effective management of workplace spaces. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of PMS with other workplace management systems. Provide expertise in workplace space management, including space planning, occupancy management, and move management. Develop and implement workplace service strategies to ensure high-quality service delivery to Accenture people and businesses globally. Stay updated with the latest advancements in workplace management and service solutions, integrating innovative approaches for sustained competitive advantage. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Expertise in Property Management Systems (PMS). Good To Have Skills:Knowledge of workplace space management, including space planning, occupancy management, and move management. Strong understanding of workplace service strategies and service delivery. Experience in collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of workplace management systems. Solid grasp of the latest advancements in workplace management and service solutions. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 12 years of experience in Property Management Systems (PMS). The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in workplace management, facilities management, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful workplace management and service solutions. This position is based at our Bengaluru office. Qualification Role for Property Management System

column2: Skill required:  Banking Services - Core Banking Designation:  Business Advisory Analyst Qualifications: BCom/MCom/Master of Business Administration  Years of Experience: 3 to 5 years  Language - Ability: English - Intermediate  About Accenture Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security.Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Technology and Operations services, and Accenture Song all powered by the worlds largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 699,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities.Visit us at www.accenture.com  What would you do? We help clients address quality and productivity issues, keep pace with customer expectations, navigate regulatory and operational pressures and ensure business sustainability by transforming their banking operations into an agile, resilient operating model.In this team, you will help in providing universal banking functionality to banks. With a focus on product strategy and a global market presence. This team will help in providing solutions to customers on industry-accepted platforms and Lead Product Managers to build an ecosystem of products and assets around these platforms namely Bancs, Finacle, Finastra, Pega, nCino. What are we looking for? Candidate with FX trade settlement / Confirmation / Payment backgroundCandidate with FX trade settlement / Confirmation / Payment background  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification BCom,MCom,Master of Business Administration

column1: Executive Assistant To CEO/ Senior Management
column2: We are      seeking     a highly organized and proactive Executive Assistant to provide exceptional support to the Senior Managers of MAQ Software. You will be a trusted confidante, managing their calendars, schedules, and ensuring smooth day-to-day operations in the project management office.                     Key Responsibilities:                             Schedule Management:             Manage calendars - scheduling appointments, meetings, and travel arrangements.             Prioritize tasks and manage competing demands to ensure efficient use of executives time.             Act as a gatekeeper, screening calls, emails, and visitors to ensure only critical matters reach the executives.                 Communication & Coordination:             Draft and proofread correspondence, presentations, and reports for the executives.             Facilitate communication between the executives and other departments within the company.             Manage and      maintain     executive databases and contact lists.                 Travel Management:             Arrange travel itineraries, including flights, accommodation, and ground transportation, ensuring smooth travel experiences for the executives.             Prepare necessary travel documents and expense reports.                 Project Management:                   Manage and prioritize projects assigned by the executives.             Conduct research and gather information to support executives decision-making processes.             Prepare briefing materials and presentations for meetings.                 Office Management:             Oversee the smooth functioning of the executive office, ensuring a professional and organized environment.             Manage office supplies and equipment.             Coordinate with administrative staff for      additional     support.                     Qualifications & Skills             :                                             Bachelor s or master s         degree or equivalent experience in business administration,          engineering,      commerce         , or a related field.             Minimum 3     -7     years of experience as an Executive Assistant or similar role, ideally within a corporate environment.             Strong organizational, time management, and communication skills.             Excellent interpersonal and problem-solving skills.             Proficiency     in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and scheduling software.             Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage multiple deadlines effectively.             Discretion, professionalism, and ability to      maintain     confidentiality.             Fluency in English and Hindi languages.

earlier draft packing list for vehicle planning, and later final packing list at the time of dispatch,         Aligning with manufacturing team for panel readiness and planning for final dispatch plan,         Aligning with Other business locations like Kalwa, Bangalore or any other place in india for dispatch from that location on Out and Out basis, ( in few cases with Job worker vendor),         Aligning with region sales for topics related to PIDI - or any special request to be take care of sharing final dispatch docs, update details in PEGA tool,         Aligning segment sales for line item creation, ICB sales invoice submission, closing related topics         Aligning with GBS for credit limit for removal of error in billing,          Aligning with IDT team for any topics related to Eway bill errors, Merchant export related queries clearing, any other topic of GST relevance         Aligning with Exim team for any topics related to export documentation, its approval, and getting the relevant docs for getting duty benefits         Aligning with CHA for clearance of goods for exports with required documentation         Aligning with Freight forwarder for vessel schedule and space - etc         Aligning with Project managers for topics related to dispatch, Out-Out dispatch attending daily TO call, and continuous basis follow up for any planning multi-location dispatch, updating PEGA PIDI         Aligning with segment commercial for credit notes etc         Other Jobs apart from handling Dispatches       1.     Cashflow preparation with in-depth analysis and alignment with stakeholders     2.     Implementation of SETU auto GRN & also contribute to various digitalization efforts     3.     Work on monthly GST utilization & GST Mismatch cases and its resolution     4.     Supporting in system resolution topics, and testing for new solutions in sap by active participation     5.     Transportation Packing cost tracking and posting to sale orders     6.     GRN for service cases after due check up - transporter Bills & other services     7.     Bi-annual Inventory verification and audits     8.     Preparation for provision vouchers supporting in month ends along with PAS vouchers             Desired skills for this job role is -         Since the job involves connecting with multiple people, good Mail & verbal communication skills and over all availability, expected to have knowledge of Siemens SAP systems, mostly dispatch related and Service GRN, Capable of handling dispatches of domestic & export     Minimum experience of 3-4 years along with bachelor s or master s in finance      IT Skills: MS office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), SAP knowledge

column2: Exciting Opportunity for the Purchase Officer Role! Join our team today and grow with us! Are you a motivated and detail-oriented individual with a knack for numbers? We are on the lookout for a dedicated Purchase Officer to join our team and contribute to our financial operations. Qualifications: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com.) degree or Business Administration/ Supply Chain Management or equivalent MBA in Supply Chain Management is desirable (Not Mandatory) Minimum 5 years of experience as Purchasing Head in a higher education institution will be preferred In-depth knowledge of procurement principles, strategies and best practices followed for prudent procurement. Skills Required: Exposure in Government Purchase Rules, including GFR will be an added advantage Skill in e-tendering process and excel tools Knowledge of vendor management processes Responsibilities: Leading a team of Procurement Unit Looking after the entire procurements of the university, including academic departments, seamlessly, under the direction of the Registrar & Finance Officer Age limit:  Minimum 45 years Additional Requirements: Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills Strong communication skills, both verbal and written Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team Job Types:  Full-time, Permanent Salary:  Rs. 20,000-25,000/- Gross per month Places of Work:  Barasat If you are ready to kick-start your career in procurement or take the next step in your journey, please send your updated resume along with a brief cover letter highlighting your relevant experience.  Why Brainware University? Join a dynamic and collaborative academic environment. Access to state-of-the-art facilities and resources. Opportunities for research, professional development, and collaboration. Competitive compensation starting with yearly incentives and other comprehensive benefits. How to Apply:  If you are excited about shaping your career as a Purchase Officer, we encourage you to apply. Send your resume, cover letter, and a brief statement of your teaching philosophy to  upama.hr@brainwareuniversity.ac.in  or call at  93309-70712 . You may visit our website:  www.brainwareuniversity.ac.in. Please use "Purchase Officer" in the subject line. Join Brainware University and make a difference in the field of education. Your expertise can inspire the future!

column1: Sr Manager- Audit, Risk & Process Management
column2: JD- Sr Manager- Audit, Risk & Process Management This role holds primary responsibility of handling & conducting inter department audit, identifying the major risks & taking necessary mitigation measures and process improvement. The incumbent in this position will be responsible for carrying out the independent and objective assessment of the adequacy and effectiveness of operational systems and controls of the Admin & Facilities Department. Qualifications and Experience:   Qualifications/ Education   Bachelor?? degree in any discipline.  Career Experience  ??Minimum 8-10 Years exposure in Audit & Risk Management, Quality Assurance and Quality Control Department. Job Description: 1.  To conduct regular audits of the administration department?? process and procedures to ensure compliance with the company policies and regulations. 2. Ensure adherence to internal controls and perform regular reviews to identify and address any deficiencies. 3. Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to address audit findings and implement corrective measures as needed. Prepare a report after finalization and discussion with superiors on action plan. 4. Execute a structured audit plan that covers administration, facilities, and other statutory aspects across branches of PFL. 5. Identify potential risks and vulnerabilities in the administrative operations and develop strategies to mitigate them. Spearhead RCM activities for administration department and provide with the response.  6. Develop and implement risk management strategies to protect the administration department from potential threats and hazards. 7. Evaluate threat perceptions (Security & Safety) and sensitize employees towards security issues, cautious measures etc.  8. Collaborate with the department leaders to establish and maintain efficient and effective processes that meet business objectives and deliver results. 9. To analyze and monitor key performance indicators to measure the effectiveness of administrative processes and identify areas for improvement. 10. Provide recommendations for process improvements and implementing best practices to drive operational excellence. 11. Keep abreast of industry trends, regulatory changes and best practices related to risk, audit and process excellence in the administration department. 12. Communicate the findings and recommendations to senior management and provide support and guidance to the administration team on risk and process related matters. 13. Conduct benchmarking activities with peers in the industry to maintain knowledge of complex industry trends, current operational issues and update management on risk and threat that could impact company business. Role & responsibilities   Preferred candidate profile   Perks and benefits
column11: Admin Process Management, Front Office, Front Office Management, Admin audit, Administration Work
